timeline.message: move non-entity DTO to respones subpackage

timeline.bodyText: I presume you meant "representation"?
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: Same typo again?
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: I believe the terminology decided on was "quality level" not label?
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: quality level
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText:
Sounds strange, suggestion:
"SCM repository where the build's sources are stored."
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: Mixed terminology: You use build config in other doc strings, here you use build configuration.
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: "A Build Config contains..."
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText:
Spelling mistakes:
mede -> made
alfanumeric -> alphanumeric
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText:
Clunky.
Suggestion:
"It defines pre-build operations and sets the proper repository"
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText:
This could probably do with a little more explanation:
My suggestion:
"This class is used to maintain an audit trail of modifications made to a Build Config. Each instance represents a specific revision of a build config."
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText:
Sounds strange, suggestion:
"SCM repository where the build's sources are stored."
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: If you agree to the change on the full entity, change also here on the ref.
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: Is this actually a revision number? Isn't the counter shared by all revisions? If so it could be a bit misleading to call it the revision number of a build config? If i'm wrong ignore this :)
timeline.author: alexcreasy

replies.bodyText: I think it may be shared by all the build configs. But isn't it still a revision number? What would you call it instead?
replies.author: janinko

replies.bodyText: I interpret "revision number" in the sense that 4 would mean the 4th revision of this build config. That might just be me, I would call it a "revision ID" if it is just a unique identifier for the revision instance in the DB.
replies.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: If accepting suggested change on full entity, also change here on ref.
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: A Milestone
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: Clunky. Suggestion: "The ProductVersion this milestone belongs to"
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: A Milestone .... the product(...
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: A Product
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: "product"
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: [double or -> use comma] "... assigned to a particular product, product version or product release"
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: a version of
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: needs
timeline.author: alexcreasy

timeline.bodyText: Is the "Representation of" needed here? IMO every object is a representation of something, so I would drop it.
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: Again "Representation of".
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: I would change the first sentence to "A unique identifier of the artifact in a repository."
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: "qualifier" => "classifier"
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: This is the path inside the repository, not path to the repository.
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: We should here that for built artifacts the value is always null.
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: Also here the value is null for built artifact.
timeline.author: pkocandr

timeline.bodyText: Drop the "representation of " also here please.
timeline.author: pkocandr
